snippet: Nearly 20 years after Joan Purser-Gennace helped convict Robert Jones of a murder in Queens, she testified that her identification was false, and coerced by the police.
abstract: Joan Purser-Gennace recants nearly 20-year-old testimony in New York State Supreme Court in Queens at hearing on behalf of Robert Jones, serving 25 years to life for 1994 murder; Purser-Gennace tells court that much of her testimony at time, which helped convict Jones, was false, spoon-fed to her by police detectives; after hearing concludes, Justice Joseph A Zayas will decide whether to set aside conviction and order new trial.
lead_paragraph: Nearly 20 years after Joan Purser-Gennace helped convict Robert Jones of a murder in Queens, she testified that her identification was false, and coerced by the police.

headline.main: Saying Police Fed ‘Lies,’ Witness to ’94 Murder Recants
headline.print_headline: Saying Police Fed ‘Lies,’ Witness to ’94 Murder Recants
